module.name: geometric_constraints
module.purpose: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the definition of explicit geometric constraints. It defines specialized representations for a set of explicit geometric constraints applicable specifically to elements of shape models of the boundary representation and closely related types.

inscope.li: explicit geometric constraints as descriptive relationships between points, curves and surfaces in a product shape model, both in two and in three dimensions;
defined constraints, for the representation of geometric relationships defined descriptively, with implied mathematical semantics;
geometric constraints with associated linear or angular dimensions;
items within the scope of application module Explicit constraints, ISO/TS 10303-1788;
items within the scope of application module Primitive solids, ISO/TS 10303-1791;
items within the scope of application module Swept solid, ISO/TS 10303-1321.
